alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 2:53PM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches with localized amounts up to 3 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For eastern Utah total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches in the Abajos and La Sal mountains with 2 to 6 inches along Highway 191. * WHERE...In Utah, La Sal and Abajo Mountains. In Colorado, Grand and Battlement Mesas, West Elk and Sawatch Mountains and Uncompahgre Plateau and Dallas Divide. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
